page.title: 05Ombersley's Main Roads
page.content: There are{two main roads}in Ombersley. The A449 leads from Worcester to Kidderminster and is the busiest road. The A4133 leading to Droitwich and Tenbury is the least busy because it connects with smaller towns. The{busiest times}are before 9.00am and about 5.00pm when people conmmute to work. Much traffic comes through Ombersley because it is central to several large towns and because the{bridge} at nearby Holt is one of the few places to cross the River Severn. On Bank Holiday the A449 becomes busier because of people travelling from the Midlands joining the M5 at Worcester to go to the seaside.The by-pass was built around Ombersley on the A449 due to traffic jams and because the people did not like the fumes and the noise from the vehicles.
